title: Daunte Wright Funeral Is Thursday in Minneapolis
sub_head: George Floyd’s family to attend; Al Sharpton to give a eulogy for the 20-year-old Black man killed by police
body:
MINNEAPOLIS—The funeral for Daunte Wright, the 20-year-old Black man killed by police last week in a Minneapolis suburb, will be held here Thursday afternoon.
In attendance will be George Floyd’s family, members of whom have been in Minneapolis for the trial of former police officer Derek Chauvin, who was found guilty Tuesday of second-degree murder in Mr. Floyd’s death.
“It feels like a never-ending cycle” of police killings, said Philonise Floyd, Mr. Floyd’s brother.
Brandon Williams, Mr. Floyd’s nephew, agreed. “It’s like, when does it stop?” he said, noting that police killed a Black teenage girl in Columbus, Ohio, on Tuesday, the same day as Mr. Chauvin’s guilty verdict. “We don’t want families to go through the pain that we go through.”
Rev. Al Sharpton is scheduled to deliver a eulogy for Mr. Wright at the Thursday services at Shiloh Temple International Ministries. He also delivered a eulogy for Mr. Floyd when he was laid to rest last year.
